name: dropkickpikachu
text: The running "KILL THE LIGHT!" gag in this story arc always perplexed me, and I don't know why.

name: hellaedgar
text: So the cops wouldn't see the light and think to check in the dumbwaiter.

name: choosebro
text: I thought that it existed so that the reader could know who was speaking, placing Roast Beef. It doesn't really matter who is speaking on the left, but it is important that the reader knows that it is Beef's story.

name: qwerty
text: Todd, who is high on the drugs and somewhat twitchy about being caught is shouting to kill the light.

name: dovey
text: I think it's Teodor

name: fermatprime
text: It's totally Lyle. Teodor wouldn't say "didja."

name: darthemed
text: Nah, it's Lyle. He'd be the one most likely to catch the  attention of the cops.

name: jthm_guitarist
text: In the last comic Todd is told to kill the light

name: luckypyjamas
text: beef's lack of punctuation and smaller text would have made his dialogue recognizable even without the light, though

name: choosebro
text: But then it would just be 6 panels of black, the illustrator's dream.

name: snowman
text: Yes, illustrators love...not illustrating anything.  That is ideal for them.

name: snowman
text: That sounded kind of cockish, sorry.

name: choosebro
text: I meant it more as that an illustrator could be paid to "illustrate" a strip by just going colouring 5 panels black.

name: fallow_fields
text:
a) In that panel alone, the reader finds out that there's at least 3 characters, and they're hiding in the dark. It sets up the gag for the one-time reader and ties into the previous strip for the devotee.

b) That panel is the one thing saving this strip from having no drawings whatsoever. It's arguable that aside from the bold lexicon and devil-may-care syntax of Achewood, the best part is the aesthetic genius of the strip. In particular, I find that facial expressions are one of the more frequent topics discussed on AcheWorld

name: wite_rabit
text: T-t-t-t-todd, Vlad, Teodore, and Lyle

name: connellingus
text: This strip demonstrates how great the dialogue is in Achewood, since you can almost always tell exactly which character is speaking, even if you can't see him.

name: achilleselbow
text: So Cornelius is definitely here, since only he would say the first line. Obviously Vlad too, and Todd is the one with the stutter. "Didja" sounds like something Lyle would say, so he could also be the one yelling to kill the light, or that could be Teodor.
